sentences.english: "And what are you going to do with the nice new frown?" the Pugilist asked.
sentences.chinese: “那麼你打算如何處理好新皺眉？”的拳拳師問道。

sentences.english: The champion was dethroned by a young boxer.
sentences.chinese: 年輕的拳師打敗了衛冕冠軍。

sentences.english: Newspaper men can't do good work on the THINKING of twenty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 職業拳師不能靠十年前喫的牛排打贏今日的對手。

sentences.english: When women kiss, it always reminds me of prize fighters shaking hands.
sentences.chinese: 當女性接吻之際，常使我想起職業拳師們的握手禮。

sentences.english: I' m sure he' ll make a master boxer.
sentences.chinese: 我相信他會成爲一名身手不凡的拳師。

sentences.english: Pugilist met the Moral Sentiment of the Community, who was carrying a hat-box.
sentences.chinese: 阿拳拳師會見了共同體，誰是帶着帽盒的道德情感。

sentences.english: I'm sure he'll make a master boxer.
sentences.chinese: 我相信他會成爲一名身手不凡的拳師。

sentences.english: "What have you in the hat-box, my friend?" inquired the Pugilist.
sentences.chinese: “什麼都在帽盒你，我的朋友？”詢問拳拳師。

definition: to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
to take refuge in religious life
a kind of traditional Chinese sword-play
Lee Lai-Shan (1970-), former windsurfing world champion from Hong Kong
to move an army and send a general (idiom); to deploy an army/to send a team on a task
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
Long Xing Quan - "Dragon Fist" - Martial Art
